page.title: 01TAW VALLEY. BISHOPS TAWTON
page.content: The area is predominately pasture land lying in the Taw valley just above the tidal high water level. The main feature is the Hall estate which is still run by the Chichester family as it has been for centuries past. The Taw river is abundan in salmon and trout in these reaches. A sawmill producing mainly farming requirements operates at Chapelton offering some alternative employment. A water treatment plant is being built at Herner to purify water extracted from the river Taw during the frequent drought conditions which affect this area. The main Exeter to Barnstaple single track railway passes through the area with one stop at Chapleton which is now an unmanned station. One bus service passes through the area, operating 5 services daily to and from Exeter. Some fields and valleys abound
